input.content: Act as a professional researcher in organic chemistry.

Which compound is in the reactants or reagents of the following reaction? 
a) c4ccc(B3OB(c1ccccc1)OB(c2ccccc2)O3)cc4
b) c4ccc(B3OB(c1ccccc1)OB(c2ccccc2)O3)cc4
c) c4ccc(B3OB(c1ccccc1)OB(c2ccccc2)O3)cc4
d) CI 
Only write the options and values down, such as 'b) 2045.1'.
The new reaction you should deal with is the first step in the first reaction in Section "2.2 Procedures".
Act as a professional researcher in organic chemistry.

Which compound is in the reactants or reagents of the following reaction? 
a) c4ccc(B3OB(c1ccccc1)OB(c2ccccc2)O3)cc4
b) O=C(C(C)C(OC)=O)C1CC1
c) CC(=O)OP(=O)([O-])[O-].[NH4+].[NH4+]
d) COC(=O)/C(C)=C(/OS(=O)(=O)c1ccc(C)cc1)C1CC1 
Only write the options and values down, such as 'b) 2045.1'.
The new reaction you should deal with is the second step in the first reaction in Section "2.2 Procedures".
Act as a professional researcher in organic chemistry.

Only write the options and values down, such as 'b) 2045.1'.
The new reaction you should deal with is the first reaction in Section "2.1 Procedures".
Act as a professional researcher in organic chemistry.

c) C#CC(O)(CO)CO
d) CN(C)C(=O)Oc1ccc(OC(=O)N(C)C)cc1 
Only write the options and values down, such as 'b) 2045.1'.
The new reaction you should deal with is the Synthesis of (R)-2-ethynylglyceraldehyde (7) using immobilized galactose oxidase.
Act as a professional researcher in organic chemistry.
